Morgan Stanley said Monday morning that Stephen S. Roach, the bank's chief economist, would move to Hong Kong from New York and become the chairman of its Asia operations, in the latest sign of Asia's growing economic and financial importance.
Mr. Roach, one of the most famous economists on Wall Street, has been increasingly gloomy about the future of the American economy, and much more optimistic about the prospects for China and India.

Mr. Roach will be in charge of handling the bank's relations with governments and clients. He has been with Morgan Stanley for 25 years and has been its chief economist for the last 16 years. He is the first economist whom the bank has named to such a senior position.
